alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN ST. TAMMANY AND SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON PARISHES, WEST CENTRAL HANCOCK AND SOUTHWESTERN PEARL RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM CDT... At 300 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bush, or 12 miles west of Picayune, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Picayune, Covington, Abita Springs, Sun, Mcneil, and Bush. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 8 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock
